stream_context.summary: Kaze spent the session polishing the underground ‘oil rig’ section: minor visual tweaks, adding an oil-drill prop, and coding a brand-new enemy called “Fizz Oil.” He also reported that Course 4 (the zoo level) is now repaired and ready for external beta testing once Zeina delivers a few missing animations.

development_findings.summary: Course 4 bug-fix pass is complete; the level is ready for beta once Zeina’s new animations arrive.
development_findings.quote: I finished fixing up course four, so it's ready for beta testing. We're gonna send it off to be tested soon.

development_findings.summary: A new low-poly drill prop and denser fog were added to reinforce the oil-rig theme.
development_findings.quote: I do want to add some oil clouds in there and an oil drill.

development_findings.summary: Kaze created a custom enemy, Fizz Oil, inspired by New Mario’s Fizzlit: it crawls, ‘swoops’ into a puddle, makes nearby floors slippery, can be cleaned with soap, and will drop two coins on death.
development_findings.quote: Basically this is gonna slime around, then when it sees Mario it's gonna go whoop and turn into a puddle... Hitting them with soap just kills them—just make him drop two coins.

development_findings.summary: He avoided engine edits by dynamically altering the surface triangle under Mario each frame to apply slipperiness, saving 1–4 μs per frame.
development_findings.quote: Since we don't want to touch engine code… we edit the surface, then reset it. You're gonna waste 0.1 microseconds otherwise.

development_findings.summary: Hash-table based geo layouts were recently adopted, raising usable model IDs to 0x60 and freeing memory for larger scenes.
development_findings.quote: We have hashing tables now instead of normal geo layouts… we can actually have up to model ID 0x60, which is insane.

development_findings.summary: Remaining tasks for the area: implement boiling-oil environmental effect, scatter ‘dead fish’, and place decorative oil clouds.
Fast64 is open-source; community fixes are welcome, as current render bugs make Blender previews unreliable.
development_findings.quote: Fast 64 is open source and people are working on fixing the program up, although I wish there were more people working on Fast 64.

development_findings.summary: Kaze noted a cache-related performance issue in the scale-table matrix and left himself a to-do to transpose it.
development_findings.quote: Transpose the scale table matrix… what it is right now is terrible for cache.

development_findings.summary: He is considering slightly nerfing the moonswim ability and toyed with the idea of an optional procedurally generated ‘infinite world’ post-game.

context_findings.summary: Kaze works from his basement and juggles development with new family responsibilities, influencing project scope.
context_findings.quote: I have a family now that I need to provide for, so I can't just fuck around with my time.

context_findings.summary: Financial reality is a key filter: he’d love to make an original N64 game but sees it as economically unviable right now.
context_findings.quote: I wish I could, but it's not financially viable… I have to make sensible decisions.

context_findings.summary: He plans to open-source the full engine after release so others can maintain and build upon it.
context_findings.quote: I will definitely open-source this… I want people to be able to maintain this code base after I leave the scene.

context_findings.summary: Design philosophy: not every enemy must be lethal; ‘vibe’ and thematic fit are equally valued.
context_findings.quote: They’re here for the vibes, you know? They don't need to be super dangerous.

biobak.summary: Biobak appears chiefly as graphics QA; Kaze pre-emptively removed excess polygons to avoid Biobak ‘cussing him out’.
biobak.quote: There are some polygons I can remove here… before Biobak cusses me out.

zeina.summary: Zeina is animating zoo assets; completion of those animations gates Course 4’s beta.
zeina.quote: All we're waiting now is for a few animations that Zeina's making and after that Course 4 is once again functional.

key_stories.title: Repairing the Zoo (Course 4)
key_stories.summary: Earlier fixes in other courses broke much of the zoo. Kaze spent off-camera time restoring assets and collision. Only Zeina’s new animations remain before external testers can play.
key_stories.process: Kaze audited the level and repaired models, collisions, and scripts.
key_stories.outcome: Course 4 is now stable and queued for beta testing.
key_stories.key_quote: Somehow whenever we work, we're breaking a bunch of old levels, so I'm going through them all again and fixing them.

key_stories.title: Birth of Fizz Oil
key_stories.summary: Kaze wanted a unique oil-based enemy to match the new rig area. He sketched behaviour, built the model, animated eye texture shifts, programmed movement, surface editing, and particles, and balanced its threat level.
key_stories.challenge: Create an N64-style low-poly enemy that feels fresh and environmental.
key_stories.process: Modeled a 256-poly blob, coded crawl-swoop-puddle states, dynamic slipperiness, soap vulnerability, and death particles.
key_stories.outcome: Fully functional enemy ready for placement; only boiling-oil FX remain.
key_stories.key_quote: This is gonna slime around, and then when it sees Mario it's gonna go whoop… then you can slide on it.

key_stories.title: Slippery Surfaces Without Engine Hacks
key_stories.summary: To keep the code-base portable, Kaze refused to modify core engine physics. Instead, he edits the floor triangle under Mario each frame when near Fizz Oil, applying a slippery flag and restoring it on exit.
key_stories.challenge: Add a new physics effect without touching shared engine code.
key_stories.process: Identified triangle pointer, backed it up in object memory, toggled surface flags per frame.
key_stories.outcome: Feature works, saves microseconds, and preserves code cleanliness.
key_stories.key_quote: We can do this without an engine change… just dynamically edit the triangle. One less D-cache access per frame.

open_questions.context: He wants to add dead fish to sell the polluted theme but hasn’t chosen a method.
